title: vignette
text: , ’ll show use functions package exemplary data analysis. goal see relationship pre-game favorites end-game results. data analyze MLB NBA betting odds. Link data

title: vignette
code: if (!dir.exists(here("data"))) {     dir.create(here("data")) } mlb_colors <- teamcolors::teamcolors %>%   filter(league == "mlb") %>%   rename(team = name) %>%   select(team, primary)  away_team_lines <- mlb_odds_2019 %>%   select(away_name, away_close_ml) %>%   mutate(implied_ml = US2Implied(away_close_ml)) %>%   rename(team = away_name) %>%   select(team, implied_ml)  home_team_lines <- mlb_odds_2019 %>%   select(home_name, home_close_ml) %>%   mutate(implied_ml = US2Implied(home_close_ml)) %>%   rename(team = home_name) %>%   select(team, implied_ml)  avg_2019_mlb_ml <- rbind(away_team_lines, home_team_lines) %>%   group_by(team) %>%   summarize(avg_implied_ml = mean(implied_ml),             avg_ml_line = Implied2US(mean(implied_ml))) %>%   left_join(mlb_colors, by = "team") %>%   arrange(desc(avg_ml_line)) %>%   slice(-n()) %>%   mutate(team = fct_reorder(team, avg_ml_line, .desc = TRUE),          primary = fct_reorder(primary, avg_ml_line, .desc = TRUE)) %>%   ungroup()  avg_2019_mlb_ml %>%   ggplot(aes(x = team, y = avg_ml_line, label = avg_ml_line)) +   geom_col(fill = avg_2019_mlb_ml$primary) +   coord_flip() +   labs(y = "Average Moneyline",        x = "Team Name",        title = "Average moneyline for each team during\nthe 2019 MLB Season",        subtitle = "Houston Astros has the lowest ML on average",        caption = "Data Source: Sports-Statistics.com ") nba_odds_2020 <- nba_odds_2020 %>%   mutate(date = ymd(date))  nba_odds_2020 <- nba_odds_2020 %>%   mutate(     game_result = purrr::map2(home_score, away_score, ~ case_when(       .x > .y ~ "Home Win",       .x < .y ~ "Away Win",       TRUE ~ "Tie"     ))   )  nba_odds_2020$game_result <- as.character(nba_odds_2020$game_result)  ggplot(nba_odds_2020, aes(x = home_ml, y = away_ml, color = game_result)) +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Moneyline Distribution",        subtitle = "NBA 2020 Season",        x = "Home Moneyline",        y = "Away Moneyline",        caption = "Data Source: Sports-Statistics.com ") nba_odds_2020 <- nba_odds_2020 %>%   mutate(higher_ml_winner = pmap_chr(list(home_ml, away_ml, game_result),                                      function(home_ml, away_ml, game_result) {                                        if ((game_result == "Home Win" && home_ml > away_ml) ||                                            (game_result == "Away Win" && away_ml > home_ml)) {                                          return("Yes")                                        } else {                                          return("No")                                        }                                      }))  ggplot(nba_odds_2020, aes(x = higher_ml_winner, fill = game_result)) +   geom_bar() +   labs(title = "Relationship Between Higher Moneyline and Game Result",        subtitle = "NBA 2020 Season",        x = "Higher Moneyline Winner",        y = "Count",        caption = "Data Source: Sports-Statistics.com ") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Home Win" = "skyblue", "Away Win" = "coral")) nba_odds_2020$game_number <- seq_along(nba_odds_2020$away_name) ggplot(nba_odds_2020, aes(x = game_number, y = away_ml, group = 1)) +   geom_line(color = "blue", linetype = "dashed", aes(y = home_ml)) +   facet_wrap(~game_result) +   labs(title = "Moneyline Odds Across Games",        subtitle = "NBA 2020 Season",        x = "Game Number",        y = "Moneyline Odds",        caption = "Data Source: Sports-Statistics.com ")

title: vignette
text: Moneyline two teams inversely correlated, lower odds moneyline greater magnitude. “Underdog” away teams prevails often underdog home teams.

title: vignette
text: dplyr: filter, mutate, group, select, left_join, arrange lubridate: year purrr: pmap, map2 ggplot2: geom_col, geom_point, geom_line, facet_wrap, geom_bar()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Peter Wu. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wu P (2023). bettingtools: Betting Tools. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bettingtools: Betting Tools},   author = {Peter Wu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Betting Tools
text: Author: Peter Wu bettingtools package functions related working sports betting lines. First, provide functions work American, Decimal, Implied odds tidy format. Next, provide functions work sports betting lines calculating zero-vig probabilities, theoretical hold, optimal single Kelly stake bet. Furthermore, package comes tidy datasets historical NBA (work progress), MLB, NFL (work progress), NHL (work progress) Vegas lines moneylines, point totals, point spreads. functions take inspiration posts user “Ganchrow” Sportsbook Review forum. Link original GitHub respiratory Link deployed website Customizations: Added template Added links sidebar Modified footer Modified navigation bar height Added github link navbar

title: Betting Tools
text: can also, example, calculate average /movement, average away/home closing moneyline, whether closing moneylines sharper opening moneylines given Vegas, average. can see home teams tended favored often, average, away teams. Furthermore, also evidence closing moneylines indeed sharper opening moneylines 2%.
code: remotes::install_github("pwu97/bettingtools") # What is the average O/U movement for games in which there was line movement? mlb_odds_2019 %>%   mutate(ou_movement = close_ou_line - open_ou_line) %>%   filter(ou_movement != 0) %>%   summarize(mean_ou_movement = mean(ou_movement)) %>%   pull(mean_ou_movement) #> [1] -0.01659751  # What is the average away closing moneyline? mlb_odds_2019 %>%   mutate(away_implied = US2Implied(away_close_ml)) %>%   summarize(avg_away_closing_ml = Implied2US(mean(away_implied))) %>%   pull(avg_away_closing_ml) #> [1] 109.7098  # What is the average home closing moneyline? mlb_odds_2019 %>%   mutate(home_implied = US2Implied(home_close_ml)) %>%   summarize(avg_home_closing_ml = Implied2US(mean(home_implied))) %>%   pull(avg_home_closing_ml) #> [1] -119.2058  # Are closing moneylines sharper than opening moneylines? mlb_odds_2019 %>%   mutate(fav_team_won_open = ifelse((((away_score > home_score) &                                        (away_open_ml < home_open_ml)) |                                      ((away_score < home_score) &                                        (away_open_ml > home_open_ml))), 1, 0),          fav_team_won_close = ifelse((((away_score > home_score) &                                        (away_close_ml < home_close_ml)) |                                      ((away_score < home_score) &                                        (away_close_ml > home_close_ml))), 1, 0)) %>%   summarize(pct_fav_won_open = mean(fav_team_won_open, na.rm = TRUE),             pct_fav_won_close = mean(fav_team_won_close, na.rm = TRUE),             pct_diff = pct_fav_won_close - pct_fav_won_open) #> # A tibble: 1 x 3 #>   pct_fav_won_open pct_fav_won_close pct_diff #>              <dbl>             <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1            0.573             0.592   0.0191

title: Betting Tools
text: can calculate percentage one’s bankroll one bet maximize expected growth one’s bankroll single bet. Given expected win probability, payout odds, optional Kelly multiplier factor, can calculate one’s optimal single Kelly stake. Note default odds expected win probability implied probability (“prob”) default odds payout decimal (“dec”). can change accordingly see fit specifying additional parameters function (“prob”, “dec”, “us”).
code: library(bettingtools)  calculateKellyStake(0.53, 1.92) #> [1] 0.0191  calculateKellyStake(0.41, 2.56) #> [1] 0.0318  # Getting a bet at +150 when it is expected to hit at -120 calculateKellyStake(-120, 150, expected_odds = "us", payout_odds = "us") #> [1] 0.2425  # Getting a bet at -150 when expected probability is 70% at a 10% kelly multiplier. calculateKellyStake(0.70, -150, kelly_multiplier = 0.1, payout_odds = "us") #> [1] 0.0252  # Optimal move is to not place a bet calculateKellyStake(0.26, -110, payout_odds = "us") #> [1] 0

what: Calculate all possible win-loss outcomes given probabilities
title: Betting Tools
text: return tibble row one possible outcome can observe list given probabilities.

title: Betting Tools
text: can calculate zero-vig implied probabilities vector lines. default precision set 4 digits. Note can set precision.

what: Calculate implied probabilities for two-outcome line set
title: Betting Tools
text: can calculate implied probabilities two lines first calculating zero-vig implied probabilities , normalizing . , can set precision.

title: Betting Tools
text: can calculate theoretical hold two-outcome line set. corresponds profit sportsbook expect make player bet either side event else equal. Contrary popular belief, larger nominal spreads doesn’t necessarily mean profit bookies.

what: Convert American or Decimal Odds to Zero-Vig Fair Odds
title: Betting Tools
text: can convert pair American Decimal odds fair zero-vig counterpart calculating individual zero-vig probabilities normalizing .

what: Calculates a single Kelly stake — calculateKellyStake
title: Calculates a single Kelly stake — calculateKellyStake
text: Returns single Kelly stake. percentage one's bankroll one bet maximize expected growth one's bankroll single bet. known single Kelly stake.

title: Calculates a single Kelly stake — calculateKellyStake
code: calculateKellyStake(   expected,   payout,   kelly_multiplier = 1,   expected_odds = "prob",   payout_odds = "dec" )

title: Calculates a single Kelly stake — calculateKellyStake
text: expected numerical value representing odds expected payout. payout numerical value representing odds actual payout. kelly_multiplier numerical value representing kelly multiplier bet. default value Kelly multiplier 1. expected_odds string representing odds format expected payout. either "prob", "dec", "us". default odds format implied probability. payout_odds string representing odds format actual payout. either "prob", "dec", "us". default odds format decimal odds.

title: Calculates a single Kelly stake — calculateKellyStake
text: single Kelly stake.

title: Calculates a single Kelly stake — calculateKellyStake
code: calculateKellyStake(0.41, 2.56) #> [1] 0.0318  calculateKellyStake(-120, 150, expected_odds = "us", payout_odds = "us") #> [1] 0.2425  calculateKellyStake(0.70, -150, kelly_multiplier = 0.1, payout_odds = "us") #> [1] 0.0252  calculateKellyStake(0.26, -110, payout_odds = "us") #> [1] 0
